title: 'Disturbed' man gets a FINE after masturbating in front of a five-year-old girl at a Target store
text:
A man who was caught masturbating in front of a five-year-old girl and her mother in a Target store in Perth has received a fine.

Allan Gordon Gill told Perth Magistrates Court he 'didn't know where he was or what he was doing' when he was seen touching himself on May 7.

The 52-year-old entered Target in Subiaco at 4.45pm, where he went to the electronics section and was spotted masturbating by the young girl and her mother.

A man who was caught masturbating in front of a five-year-old girl and her mother in a Target store in Perth has received a fine (stock image)

He touched himself for another 40 seconds while he walked through to the toys section before leaving.

Gill suffers from mental illness, with The West Australian reporting he believes a change in his medication caused his disturbing behaviour.

'I've been on antidepressants for 20 years and stopped taking them and unfortunately this has caused me some instability,' Gill told the court.

'I couldn't find a way to cope, I'd been good but I made a mistake.'

Gill said he was 'disturbed' by media reports about his crime which he said had caused him 'distress and impacted his health'.

Gill has recently moved into a lodge in Fremantle after a losing a rental property when his landlord read reports of the masturbating incident in the media.

He was fined $500.
